column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have neuroendocrine cancer that has spread to my liver. I do not have carcinoid syndrome. My doc prescribes sando to shrink and/or stabilize growth of tumors, which is has proven to do over a period of 3 years. I have no side effects from the monthly injection.

column2: maggic, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had lot of joint pain and weakness, blurred vision blood pressure not stable,

column2: earthworm, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have injection every 28days ...very good so far. Have notice my blood glucose level falls - symptoms feel shaky . Not to often .I check my own sugar levels now ,just to see what is happening to my blood.Also good for your consultant to see the  trend ,pattern to what is happening over the course of your treatment.

column2: White Dove, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Works for my symptoms, but developed gall bladder problems and had to have it removed; now my glucose is rising each month and I hope I don't become diabetic.

column2: ernie, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been getting 30mg shot every 3 weeks, I was given 6 months to live ,that was Feb. 2000, I cant believe that I am still around. The shot site is very painful for about 1 week after receiving treatment.I believe that receiving the shot is what has prolonged my life.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Severe diarrhea, unknown cause - It was ruining my life. I was homebound until I started taking this medication and now I am symptom free. I am on 10mg a month and I visit my GI doctor monthly to receive the shot which is painful but worth it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
shirtygirty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am using Sandostatin for Crohn's Disease injecting myself 3 times a day I have found it very helpful in controlling diaroeah I recently spoke to my Specialist about having the long acting Sandostatin Injection once monthly but was told in having it I would not be able to "top it up" if need be.

column2: jeriko, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have an injection once a month by my doctor for carcinoid cancer. Five months without any problems.

column2: olaff, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been using octreotide since Oct 2001 doing about 400-500mcg daily divided by 3 to 4 inj with 31G 5/16 syringes.  The drug has kept me alive!

column1: Syndrome After Rapid Passage of Food Into Small Intestine
column2: Bluelightningjeep, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have sever dumping syndrome which had pretty much debilitated me. I have had NO serious dumping attacks since the first injection and am 90% better. I had been completely non- functional before this, and am finally starting to feel morecnormal, like eating, less tired, less sweaty, no heart palps after eating. I had given up hope. This drug has been miraculous in my case!

column2: ru, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: diagnosed with carcinoid tumors 5/07.  taking shots from onocologist since 6/07.  So far seems to be ok.

column2: mrs thinker, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i go from 1 bout to four bouts of diareah a day, mostly 3 to 4.
carcinoid tumor.  I am given a shot once a month by an oncologist.  So far no symptoms.  Been receiving shot since 6/07.
